title: Drawing, "Design for Painted Porcelain Plate, for Sèvres Porcelain Manufactory", ca. 1766
medium: Brush and watercolor and gouache, pen and brown ink, black chalk on cream laid paper
markings: Stamp:  Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration in black, lower left edge, verso:  Lugt 457d; Seal:   portion of seal in red, upper right corner, verso:   monogram "C.A."
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, upper center:  N Nº 12./ Profille Du dit plat et Sout font sc; lower center, sideways : "N Nº 12./ Plat avec le rebor de Bas relief Bleu / a Bouquet detaché
provenance:
Giovanni Piancastelli
Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Slightly scalloped plate in elevation (above) and in plan (below), decorated at quadrants with floral sprays of pink roses, yellow and red parrot tulips, and daisies and one spray at center.  Border consists of six blue acanthus leaf scrolls, with gold border at edge. Elevation above is undecorated.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Painted Porcelain Plate, for Sèvres Porcelain Manufactory", ca. 1766.
ca. 1766. Brush and watercolor and gouache, pen and brown ink, black chalk on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-8317.
